p: Chromatographic peak 5 (3.68 min) had a precursor ion [M − H] − at m/ z 179.0350, with a predicted molecular formula C 9H 7O 4 (mass error 0.2 ppm), suggesting the presence of caffeic acid. A MS2 base peak was observed at m/ z 135.0441, corresponding to the loss of -CO 2 group from caffeic acid. Furthermore, its identity was confirmed by comparing the fragmentation spectra and retention time of a caffeic acid reference standard.
